alert.note: Alert for Assumption; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche; Upper St. Bernard; Upper Terrebonne (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 07 at 10:12AM CDT until April 22 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Louisiana and southern Mississippi, including the following areas and parishes, in southeast Louisiana, Assumption, Central Plaquemines, Central Tangipahoa, Eastern Ascension, Eastern Orleans, Lower Jefferson, Lower St. Bernard, Lower Tangipahoa, Northern Livingston, Northern St. Tammany, Southeast St. Tammany, Southern Livingston, Southwestern St. Tammany, St. Charles, St. James, St. John The Baptist, Upper Jefferson, Upper Lafourche, Upper Plaquemines, Upper St. Bernard, Upper Terrebonne, Western Ascension and Western Orleans. In southern Mississippi, Northern Hancock and Southern Hancock. * WHEN...Through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations such as highly urbanized locations with poor drainage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches with locally higher amounts of up to 6 inches are expected through early tomorrow morning. The greatest concern will be in poor drainage and urbanized areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Assumption; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche; Upper St. Bernard; Upper Terrebonne
